content:
Check out my post Harry - http://www.masteringbiztalk.com/blogs/jon/PermaLink,guid,5cc60ee3-38ce-4fcd-94d7-a8ca9b3b8d5d.aspx  which clarifies things a little bit.  Even though the WF/ASMX integration doesn't use asp.net "sessions" (i am fairly certain earlier betas did) it uses a "session" cookie - which means if the client goes away - so does the cookie.  

The OOB persistence service does load all "running" workflows - just not idled workflows.  I assume I mispoke when I mentioned that feature.
